docs.title: What is the BoltRing?
docs.text: The BoltRing is the first Bitcoin DIY contactless payment ring. It uses NFC technology and the open-source Bolt Card system to bring the tap-to-pay experience to Bitcoin Lightning. You can use the BoltRing with your own self-sovereign Bitcoin Lightning node or use it with a commercial service provider.

docs.title: BoltRing Quickstart
docs.text:
There are many options for setting up and using your BoltRing with varying tradeoffs regarding convenience, security, and features. In this quickstart guide we show you how to set up the BoltRing with LNBits and the Bolt Card extension. LNBits is a free open-source lightning account system.

Safety notice

In this guide we use a public demo installation of LNbits. This means you are trusting the operators of the service with guarding your satoshis. Don´t be reckless and use it with caution and only for testing with small amounts.

docs.title: Step 0 - Requirements
docs.text:
• An existing Lightning Wallet that you can use to fund your LNBits account
  • An Android Mobile Phone with NFC support to provision your BoltRing
  • A BoltRing that has not been set up yet (or has been wiped if setup previously)

I don´t have an Android Phone!

You will only need the Android Phone for the initial setup of your BoltRing. So you could borrow an Android Phone from a friend to do the setup. Another option for iPhone users is the CoinCorner Wallet. The CoinCorner App supports BoltCard setup on both Android and iPhone devices.

docs.title: Step 1 - Install Bolt Card Creator
docs.text:
Install the Bolt Card creator app

You will need this app later to write the bolt service configuration to the BoltRing. You will also need the NFC UID of your BoltRing for this set-up. It should be printed on the leaflet that came with your BoltRing.

If you have your UID and you are in a hurry you can skip the next section and continue with step 2.

Read BoltRing NFC UID

  1. Select the Advanced tab at the bottom of the start screen of the Bolt Card Creator App
  2. Select the Read NFC tab on the stacked menue
  3. Scan your BoltRing by holding it to the back of your phone
  4. Take note of the UID of your BoltRing

Memorize NFC antenna location

Smartphones have their NFC antenna in different places. Usually it is in the upper third of the back of the phone. While scanning the BoltRing, pay attention to the position the app detects the BoltRing. This will give you more confidence when writing the configuration to the BoltRing later on.

docs.title: Step 2 - Create an LNBits Wallet
docs.text:
Do these steps from a PC

The guide assumes you create your LMBits Wallet from a desktop PC. You can also use a mobile phone browser but the screens will look different and some steps like scanning QR Codes must be done differently when using a mobile device.

  • Browse to https://legend.lnbits.com/
  • Type a memorable name for your wallet
  • Click "ADD A NEW WALLET"
  • Take note of you Wallet-URL

Secure your Wallet-URL

The LNBits wallet you created does not have a password protected login. The Wallet-URL shown in the browser after creating the wallet IS YOUR PASSWORD/LOGIN. So make a backup of the full Wallet-URL and keep it a secret.

docs.title: Step 3 - Fund your wallet
docs.text: Click the CREATE INVOICE button and send some satoshis to your LNbits wallet.

docs.title: Step 4 - Install Extension
docs.text:
Activate the LNBits Bolt Card Extension for your wallet as follows:

  • Click on Manage Extensions in the left menue
  • Click ENABLE on the Bolt Cards tile
  • Click OPEN or the new Bolt Cards item in the left menue

docs.title: Step 5 - Create Bolt Card Service
docs.text:
• Click the orange plus-button on the Bolt Cards Extension screen

On the card creation form:

  1. Select the LNBits wallet you created before
  2. Set a limit of satoshis per transaction (for example 50000)
  3. Set a limit of satoshis per day (for example 300000)
  4. Type a memorable name for your BoltRing
  5. Enter the NFC UID of your BoltRing
  6. Click CREATE CARD

After clicking CREATE CARD you should see the card service that has been created. Click the QR Code in the first column of the listview to show the QR code you will need in the next step.

After clicking the QR code symbol you should see this card creation modal.

Make sure you backup the keys shown below the QR code. You will need them if you want to reset/wipe your BoltRing at a later time. Should LNBits become unavailable these keys will be the only way to recover/reset your BoltRing.

Keep the modal window open as you will need to scan the shown QR code in the next step.

docs.title: Step 6 - BoltRing Setup
docs.text:
Go back to you mobile phone and start the Bolt Card Creator APP you installed earlier. Place your BoltRing on table, so it is ready to be scanned.

Warning

Make sure you go through these last steps in one go, because the QR code from the last step will be invalidated when you scan it. If you close the App before writing the data to the BoltRing you will have to start over from step 5 and crete a new card service entry.

  1. Go to the start screen of the Bolt Card Creator app
  2. On the start screen tap SCAN QR CODE and scan the LNbits card creation QR code
  3. Tap "WRITE CARD NOW" and position your phones NFC antenna close above the BoltRing
  4. Verify the app Output section shows all the green checkmarks

Congratultions, your BoltRing is now ready for use.
